name: samp_name
definition: A unique name used to identify an individual sample.
example: WMEA_01780_No_1

name: project_name
definition: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized.
example: C-MAIKI Waimea Supertransect 2019

name: collection_date
definition: The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval.  [YYYY]-[MM]-[DD] or [YYYY]-[MM]-[DD]/[YYYY]-[MM]-[DD] (range) or [YYYY]-[MM]-[DD]T[hh]:[mm]:[ss] (with time)

name: geo_loc_name
definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name followed by specific region name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/GAZ)
example: Atlantic Ocean:Charlie Gibbs Fracture Zone, USA: Hawaii, Honolulu, USA: Hawaii, Waimea Valley

name: lat_lon
definition: Latitude and longitude of collection location. The values should be reported in decimal degrees, limited to 8 decimal points, and listed in the order of 'latitude' 'longitude'.

name: investigator
definition: An individual who conducts scientific research, investigation, or study-related procedures. The PI responsible for obtaining the sample.
example: last name, first name

name: samp_type
definition: The type of material from which the sample was obtained.
example: Rock swab, coral, river sediment, monocot stem, tissue sample, whole organism

name: samp_mat_process
definition: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed
example: filtering of seawater, storing samples in ethanol, freeze drying

name: empo_1
definition: EMP Ontology level 1 (Organism lifestyle)
example: Free-living, host-associated, control, not applicable, unknown

name: empo_2
definition: EMP Ontology level 2 (Categories of empo_1)
example: Saline, non-saline, animal, plant, fungus, positive, negative, contradictory, missing

name: empo_3
definition: EMP Ontology level 3 (most specific habitat name)
example: See drop down options

name: specific_host
definition: Report the host's taxonomic name and/or NCBI taxonomy ID
example: Aedes albopictus or 7160

name: host_common_name
definition: Common name of the host
example: Algae, fruit fly, mosquito, bird, worm, dicot plant

name: env_broad_scale
definition: The major environmental system that the sample derived from. The biome identified should be the general environment from which the sampling was done. See http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428 biome dropdowns.
example: tropical marine coral reef, small freshwater lake, tropical moist broadleaf forest, mangrove, tropical desert, polar tundra

name: env_local_scale
definition: Report any nearby environmental features which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample (countable entities). See http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00002297 environmental feature dropdowns.
example: hydrothermal vent, rock, cave, understory, fern layer, farm, shoreline, human dwelling, hillside

name: env_medium
definition: Report any environmental material immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling (non-countable entities). We recommend using subclasses of environmental material (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483).
example: marine mud, nesting material, grain of beach sand, deep marine sediment, tropical soil, marine sludge, plant matter, pond water

name: pcr_primers
definition: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters
example: FWD: 515F 5'-GTGYCAGCMGCCGCGGTAA-3' REV:806R 5'-GGACTACNVGGGTWTCTAAT-3'

name: mid
definition: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters
example: AGCCTTCGTCGC

name: adapters
definition: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters
example: e.g. {i7:adapter sequence} {i5 adapter sequence}

name: target_gene
definition: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies
example: 16S rRNA V4, 18S rRNA, ITS

name: lib_layout
definition: Specify whether to expect single, paired, or other configuration of reads
example: single, paired

name: sequencing_location
definition: The location the sequencing run was performed. Indicate the name of the lab or core facility where samples were sequenced
example: University of Hawaii ASGPB, UC Berkeley DNA Sequencing Facility

name: seq_meth
definition: Sequencing machine used. Where possible the term should be taken from the OBI list of DNA sequencers (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0400103)
example: Illumina MiSeq, Oxford Nanopore MinION Mk1D, Illumina HiSeq 4000

name: sequencing_kit
definition: Pre-filled, ready-to-use reagent cartridges. Used to produce improved chemistry, cluster density and read length as well as improve quality (Q) scores. Reagent components are encoded to interact with the sequencing system to validate compatibility with user-defined applications. Indicate name of the sequencing kit.
example: MiSeq Reagent Kit v3 (600 cycle)

name: include_sample
definition: Whether to include this sample in the analysis
example: Include this sample in downstream analysis

name: metadata_file
definition: Upload additional metadata file
example: Additional metadata in TSV or CSV format
